Agreement between the f?khaeatieaal Television and Radio Center and Kent State
Uni varsity for handling of taped radio programs produced under grants made toy
the Educational Television and Radio Center $
1* Kent State University would be the exclusive distributor
(other than as indicated below) for non-broadcast purposes
of all taped radio programs produced under grants from the
Educational Television and Radio Center (except those excluded
in writing by the Educational Television and Radio Center or
the national Association of Educational Broadcasters). The
producer, the SXRC and the SAEB shall each also have the right
to make its own distribution from time to time, when warranted
toy justifiable circumstances*
A* Sent diets University will charge its standard rate for
distribution of duplicate® to non-eoFisaercial, educational
non«toroaclcast users*
B* Kent State University will have the right and privilege to
include cry ca* all program received in any catalog listing
developed in cooperation with or through that (Kent State)
University*
2* Kent State University will, at the tine this agreement goes into
effect, obtain one master tape of each taped radio program produced
under a grant from the Educational Television and Radio Center* This
master tape is to be retained toy Kent State University as part of
the permanent master tape library* These programs will be coded
by Kent State University and a code listing made available to both
the Educational Television and Radio Center and the Rational Association
of Educational Broadcaster's Radio Ketmvfc
